trans-unit.source: Enable Remote Desktop Connection for a Role in Azure Cloud Services
trans-unit.target: Enable Remote Desktop Connection for a Role in Azure Cloud Services

trans-unit.source: How to configure your azure cloud service application to allow remote desktop connections
trans-unit.target: How to configure your azure cloud service application to allow remote desktop connections

trans-unit.source: Enable Remote Desktop Connection for a Role in Azure Cloud Services
trans-unit.target: Enable Remote Desktop Connection for a Role in Azure Cloud Services

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: PowerShell
trans-unit.target: PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Remote Desktop enables you to access the desktop of a role running in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Remote Desktop enables you to access the desktop of a role running in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can use a Remote Desktop connection to troubleshoot and diagnose problems with your application while it is running.
trans-unit.target: You can use a Remote Desktop connection to troubleshoot and diagnose problems with your application while it is running.

trans-unit.source: You can enable a Remote Desktop connection in your role during development by including the Remote Desktop modules in your service definition or you can choose to enable Remote Desktop through the Remote Desktop Extension.
trans-unit.target: You can enable a Remote Desktop connection in your role during development by including the Remote Desktop modules in your service definition or you can choose to enable Remote Desktop through the Remote Desktop Extension.

trans-unit.source: The preferred approach is to use the Remote Desktop extension as you can enable Remote Desktop even after the application is deployed without having to redeploy your application.
trans-unit.target: The preferred approach is to use the Remote Desktop extension as you can enable Remote Desktop even after the application is deployed without having to redeploy your application.

trans-unit.source: Configure Remote Desktop from the portal
trans-unit.target: Configure Remote Desktop from the portal

trans-unit.source: The portal uses the Remote Desktop Extension approach so you can enable Remote Desktop even after the application is deployed.
trans-unit.target: The portal uses the Remote Desktop Extension approach so you can enable Remote Desktop even after the application is deployed.

trans-unit.source: The **Configure** page for your cloud service allows you to enable Remote Desktop, change the local Administrator account used to connect to the virtual machines, the certificate used in authentication and set the expiration date.
trans-unit.target: The **Configure** page for your cloud service allows you to enable Remote Desktop, change the local Administrator account used to connect to the virtual machines, the certificate used in authentication and set the expiration date.

trans-unit.source: Click **Cloud Services**, click the name of the cloud service, and then click **Configure**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Cloud Services**, click the name of the cloud service, and then click **Configure**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Remote**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Remote**.

trans-unit.source: Cloud services remote
trans-unit.target: Cloud services remote

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] All role instances will be restarted when you first enable Remote Desktop and click OK (checkmark).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] All role instances will be restarted when you first enable Remote Desktop and click OK (checkmark).

trans-unit.source: To prevent a reboot, the certificate used to encrypt the password must be installed on the role.
trans-unit.target: To prevent a reboot, the certificate used to encrypt the password must be installed on the role.

trans-unit.source: To prevent a restart, [upload a certificate for the cloud service](cloud-services-how-to-create-deploy/#how-to-upload-a-certificate-for-a-cloud-service) and then return to this dialog.
trans-unit.target: To prevent a restart, [upload a certificate for the cloud service](cloud-services-how-to-create-deploy/#how-to-upload-a-certificate-for-a-cloud-service) and then return to this dialog.

trans-unit.source: In **Roles**, select the role you want to update or select **All** for all roles.
trans-unit.target: In **Roles**, select the role you want to update or select **All** for all roles.

trans-unit.source: Make any of the following changes:
trans-unit.target: Make any of the following changes:

trans-unit.source: To enable Remote Desktop, select the **Enable Remote Desktop** check box.
trans-unit.target: To enable Remote Desktop, select the **Enable Remote Desktop** check box.

trans-unit.source: To disable Remote Desktop, clear the check box.
trans-unit.target: To disable Remote Desktop, clear the check box.

trans-unit.source: Create an account to use in Remote Desktop connections to the role instances.
trans-unit.target: Create an account to use in Remote Desktop connections to the role instances.

trans-unit.source: Update the password for the existing account.
trans-unit.target: Update the password for the existing account.

trans-unit.source: Select an uploaded certificate to use for authentication (upload the certificate using **Upload** on the **Certificates** page) or create a new certificate.
trans-unit.target: Select an uploaded certificate to use for authentication (upload the certificate using **Upload** on the **Certificates** page) or create a new certificate.

trans-unit.source: Change the expiration date for the Remote Desktop configuration.
trans-unit.target: Change the expiration date for the Remote Desktop configuration.

trans-unit.source: When you finish your configuration updates, click **OK** (checkmark).
trans-unit.target: When you finish your configuration updates, click **OK** (checkmark).

trans-unit.source: Remote into role instances
trans-unit.target: Remote into role instances

trans-unit.source: Once Remote Desktop is enabled on the roles you can remote into a role instance through various tools.
trans-unit.target: Once Remote Desktop is enabled on the roles you can remote into a role instance through various tools.

trans-unit.source: To connect to a role instance from the portal:
trans-unit.target: To connect to a role instance from the portal:

trans-unit.source: Click **Instances** to open the **Instances** page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Instances** to open the **Instances** page.

trans-unit.source: Select a role instance that has Remote Desktop configured.
trans-unit.target: Select a role instance that has Remote Desktop configured.

trans-unit.source: Click **Connect**, and follow the instructions to open the desktop.
trans-unit.target: Click **Connect**, and follow the instructions to open the desktop.

trans-unit.source: Click **Open** and then **Connect** to start the Remote Desktop connection.
trans-unit.target: Click **Open** and then **Connect** to start the Remote Desktop connection.

trans-unit.source: Use Visual Studio to remote into a role instance
trans-unit.target: Use Visual Studio to remote into a role instance

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, Server Explorer:
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, Server Explorer:

trans-unit.source: Expand the **Azure\\Cloud Services\\[cloud service name]** node.
trans-unit.target: Expand the **Azure\\Cloud Services\\[cloud service name]** node.

trans-unit.source: Expand either **Staging** or **Production**.
trans-unit.target: Expand either **Staging** or **Production**.

trans-unit.source: Expand the individual role.
trans-unit.target: Expand the individual role.

trans-unit.source: Right-click one of the role instances, click **Connect using Remote Desktop...**, and then enter the user name and password.
trans-unit.target: Right-click one of the role instances, click **Connect using Remote Desktop...**, and then enter the user name and password.

trans-unit.source: Server explorer remote desktop
trans-unit.target: Server explorer remote desktop

trans-unit.source: Use PowerShell to get the RDP file
trans-unit.target: Use PowerShell to get the RDP file

trans-unit.source: You can use the [Get-AzureRemoteDesktopFile](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn495261.aspx) cmdlet to retrieve the RDP file.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [Get-AzureRemoteDesktopFile](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn495261.aspx) cmdlet to retrieve the RDP file.

trans-unit.source: You can then use the RDP file with Remote Desktop Connection to access the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: You can then use the RDP file with Remote Desktop Connection to access the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Programmatically download the RDP file through the Service Management REST API
trans-unit.target: Programmatically download the RDP file through the Service Management REST API

trans-unit.source: You can use the [Download RDP File](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj157183.aspx) REST operation to download the RDP file.
trans-unit.target: You can use the [Download RDP File](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj157183.aspx) REST operation to download the RDP file.

trans-unit.source: To configure Remote Desktop in the service definition file
trans-unit.target: To configure Remote Desktop in the service definition file

trans-unit.source: This method allows you to enable Remote Desktop for the application during development.
trans-unit.target: This method allows you to enable Remote Desktop for the application during development.

trans-unit.source: This approach requires encrypted passwords be stored in your service configuration file and any updates to the remote desktop configuration would require a redeployment of the application.
trans-unit.target: This approach requires encrypted passwords be stored in your service configuration file and any updates to the remote desktop configuration would require a redeployment of the application.

trans-unit.source: If you want to avoid these downsides you should use the remote desktop extension based approach described above.
trans-unit.target: If you want to avoid these downsides you should use the remote desktop extension based approach described above.

trans-unit.source: You can use Visual Studio to [enable a remote desktop connection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg443832.aspx) using the service definition file approach.
trans-unit.target: You can use Visual Studio to [enable a remote desktop connection](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg443832.aspx) using the service definition file approach.

trans-unit.source: The steps below describe the changes needed to the service model files to enable remote desktop.
trans-unit.target: The steps below describe the changes needed to the service model files to enable remote desktop.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio will automatically makes these changes when publishing.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio will automatically makes these changes when publishing.

trans-unit.source: Set up the connection in the service model
trans-unit.target: Set up the connection in the service model

trans-unit.source: Use the **Imports** element to import the **RemoteAccess** module and the **RemoteForwarder** module to the [ServiceDefinition.csdef](cloud-services-model-and-package.md#csdef) file.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Imports** element to import the **RemoteAccess** module and the **RemoteForwarder** module to the [ServiceDefinition.csdef](cloud-services-model-and-package.md#csdef) file.

trans-unit.source: The service definition file should be similar to the following example with the `<Imports>` element added.
trans-unit.target: The service definition file should be similar to the following example with the `<Imports>` element added.

trans-unit.source: The [ServiceConfiguration.cscfg](cloud-services-model-and-package.md#cscfg) file should be similar to the following example, note the `<ConfigurationSettings>` and `<Certificates>` elements.
trans-unit.target: The [ServiceConfiguration.cscfg](cloud-services-model-and-package.md#cscfg) file should be similar to the following example, note the `<ConfigurationSettings>` and `<Certificates>` elements.

trans-unit.source: The Certificate specified must be [uploaded to the cloud service](cloud-services-how-to-create-deploy/#how-to-upload-a-certificate-for-a-cloud-service).
trans-unit.target: The Certificate specified must be [uploaded to the cloud service](cloud-services-how-to-create-deploy/#how-to-upload-a-certificate-for-a-cloud-service).

trans-unit.source: Additional Resources
trans-unit.target: Additional Resources

trans-unit.source: [How to Configure Cloud Services](cloud-services-how-to-configure.md)
trans-unit.target: [How to Configure Cloud Services](cloud-services-how-to-configure.md)

trans-unit.target: test
